post.title: Former Haven-X Talent Roza Coatl Join 4V Live Talent Roster
post.content:
Roza Coatl, formerly a VTuber talent from the now disbanded agency Haven-X, is officially joining the VTuber talent roster of 4V Live, a US-based agency. Coatl previously announced her departure from Haven-X on July 11 due to health concerns.

Roza Coatl, Hellfire Metalworks' resident Snake Devil Blacksmith, has torn the lid off her coffin and revived from the depths of IP hell to join 4V LIVE. Her revival stream will be on Sept. 2nd, Friday @ 6pm US ET (EDT). (1/3)#VtuberRevival@Gini_Mercury pic.twitter.com/cKsErCdbDP

— 4V LIVE | VTuber Agency (@4VLiveOfficial) August 28, 2022

By joining 4V Live, Coatl will officially be part of the agency’s new talent class called ‘4V Farfarers’, with her being the first member. The agency had previously teased her transition with a single tweet with glitched text, an allude to Coatl’s style of tweets.

Following the announcement, Coatl will be having her 4V Live debut on September 2 at 6PM EDT. In the upcoming stream, she stated that she will be addressing her reasons regarding the agency transition. This follows almost two weeks after Haven-X disbanded with the graduation of its talents Koa Himari and Viri Sylvaine.

The 4V Live VTuber roster is composed of first-generation members Vivian Voss, Orion Juno, and Angelina Kumalo; and their second-generation members Boomi Mamana, Neiomi Cielo, and Yuna Sunaga. Cecilia Amberfall, one of its second-generation talents, moved on as an independent VTuber on March 11.

Banner Photo via YouTube

node.description: A few weeks ago, we reported that AniManGaki 2022, one of the biggest annual anime/cosplay/gaming events in Malaysia, will showcase 80 VTubers.
